name: tweakcc
description: Customize your Claude Code themes, thinking verbs, and more

repo.name: tweakcc
repo.description: Customize Claude Code's system prompts, create custom toolsets, add custom themes/thinking verbs/spinner, input box style, user message display, sign-in ASCII art, fix bugs (frozen spinner), and add features (context limit customization). Supports both native (binary) and npm installs on all platforms.

readme.summary: Well-structured README with clear installation and feature list, but lacks examples showing actual usage and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section or common issues documented; users encountering problems would have limited guidance for resolution.

injection_risks.description: Potential code injection risk through the 'tweakccVersion' variable in the applyIndicatorViewPatch function
User input is not validated before being passed to the onSubmit function, potentially allowing for unintended behavior

critical_findings: Potential code injection risk in patchesAppliedIndication.ts
Lack of input validation in MainMenu.tsx
security.summary: The tweakcc package has some security concerns, including potential code injection risks and lack of input validation, but no critical secrets or error exposure issues were found.

common_complaints: Integration issues with Claude Code versions causing crashes/interruptions
API error handling limitations (fixed retry counts, no infinite retry option)
Feature injection (rate-limit-options command) breaking user workflows
Patching failures when Claude Code updates (hideCtrlGToEditPrompt patch)
Crashes on RHEL8 systems with Node 22/24
praise_themes: User appreciation for customization capabilities (themes via config.json)
Interest in enhanced feature customization (elapsed time verbs, UI preferences)
sentiment.summary: Active community engagement with moderate frustration around version compatibility and error handling, but maintainers showing responsiveness with closed issues and ongoing feature discussions.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are generally helpful and clear, showing patience with repeated questions and a good level of technical depth.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit timestamp being recent (likely repository mirror or archived state)
42 open issues with no resolution activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no active maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: The repository appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months, despite having a recent commit timestamp that likely indicates an archived or mirrored repository state.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-organized and comprehensive, but lacks clear marking of breaking changes and upgrade paths.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is detailed but cluttered with promotional content, making it hard to quickly understand the package's purpose and usage.
concerns: Docs: Excessive promotion of other products and lack of clear troubleshooting section
Community: extracting JavaScript from native binaries
Community: line number information in file reads and edits
Security: Potential code injection risk in patchesAppliedIndication.ts
Security: Lack of input validation in MainMenu.tsx
highlights: High number of commits and merged PRs in the past six months
Recent activity with a commit and release on 2026-01-04
